summary: NVIDIA reported a strong financial performance for the first quarter of fiscal 2023, achieving record revenue of $8.3 billion, which represents an 8% sequential increase and a 46% year-on-year growth. The Data Center segment has become the largest market platform for NVIDIA, showing continued momentum. The company is focused on strategic initiatives such as ramping up their AI and Omniverse engines, launching new products like Grace CPU and Orin robotics processor, and expanding their software platforms. However, the company is facing challenges from macroeconomic conditions, including potential impacts from COVID-19 and geopolitical tensions. Despite these challenges, NVIDIA remains optimistic about the Gaming industry, citing strong underlying dynamics and a significant portion of the installed base yet to adopt RTX technology. The call also highlighted the importance of software attach rates and the growing interest in various software packages, particularly in AI and natural language processing. Risks mentioned include uncertainties in the macroeconomic environment and potential cyclical impacts on Data Center growth.
key_highlights: Record revenue of $8.3 billion, up 8% sequentially and 46% year-on-year.
Data Center has become NVIDIA's largest market platform with strong growth momentum.
Strategic initiatives include launching new products like Grace CPU and Orin robotics processor.
Strong underlying dynamics in the Gaming industry, with only a third of the installed base having adopted RTX technology.
Challenges from macroeconomic conditions and uncertainties affecting future growth.

kpis.name: Total Revenue
kpis.context: Total revenue was a record, up 8% sequentially and up 46% year-on-year.

kpis.name: Gaming Revenue
kpis.context: Gaming revenue rose 6% sequentially and 31% year-on-year, powered by the GeForce RTX 30 Series product cycle.

kpis.name: Data Center Revenue
kpis.context: Data Center revenue grew 15% sequentially and accelerated to 83% growth year-on-year.

kpis.name: A100 GPU Adoption
kpis.context: Data Center growth was driven primarily by strong adoption of the A100 GPU for both training and inference.

kpis.name: Automotive Design Win Pipeline
kpis.context: Automotive design win pipeline now exceeds $11 billion over the next six years, up from $8 billion just a year ago.

kpis.name: Customer Demand
kpis.context: Customers remain supply constrained in their infrastructure needs and continue to add capacity as they try to keep pace with demand.

kpis.name: Gross Margin
kpis.context: GAAP gross margin for the first quarter was 65.5% and non-GAAP gross margin was up 67.1%, up 90 basis points from a year ago.

kpis.name: Market Share in Gaming
kpis.value: One-third of GeForce Gaming GPU installed base on RTX
kpis.context: Almost a third of the GeForce Gaming GPU installed base is now on RTX.

risk_factors.description: The ongoing conflict in Russia and the COVID lockdowns in China are expected to impact sales and revenue.
Headwinds from the macro economy could affect growth, particularly in the Data Center segment.
Challenges related to supply chain issues may impact the ability to meet demand and affect revenue.
Changes in demand for Gaming products due to external factors like cryptocurrency market trends could impact revenue.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Ramping next generation of AI infrastructure chips and platforms including Hopper GPU, BlueField DPU, NVLink, InfiniBand, Quantum InfiniBand, Spectrum Ethernet Networking.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Helping customers build their AI factories and take advantage of new AI breakthroughs.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Ramping system and software industry partners to launch Grace, NVIDIA's first CPU.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Expected to enhance computing capabilities for various applications.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Ramping Orin, the new robotics processor with nearly 40 customers building various robotic applications.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Advancing robotics technology across multiple industries.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Adding new value to the ecosystem with NVIDIA AI and NVIDIA Omniverse, and expanding into new markets with new CUDA acceleration libraries.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Enhancing the capabilities and reach of NVIDIA's software offerings.
